skill.name: enact/playwright
skill.description: Browser automation tool using Playwright - captures screenshots and extracts content from web pages
skill.summary: Browser automation tool using Playwright for capturing screenshots and extracting text or HTML content from web pages
skill.author: EnactProtocol

security_audit.summary: Static scanner flagged 16 potential issues, but all findings are false positives. The code uses safe JavaScript template literals for logging (not shell backticks), empty string fields (not weak crypto), and standard fs operations for legitimate browser path detection. The skill is a standard Playwright browser automation tool with no malicious patterns.

medium_findings.title: Filesystem Access for Browser Detection
medium_findings.description: Code accesses /ms-playwright directory to locate Chromium executable. Legitimate use for browser automation.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: fs.existsSync and fs.readdirSync are standard Node.js operations for checking browser paths in Docker environments. No sensitive files accessed.

medium_findings.title: Hardcoded URLs in Documentation
medium_findings.description: Documentation uses example.com URLs for usage examples. Standard practice, no external network calls made.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: URLs are example domain references in markdown documentation only. No network requests are made by the skill code itself.

dangerous_patterns.title: Template Literal Misidentification
dangerous_patterns.description: Static scanner misidentified JavaScript template literals as shell backtick execution. All are console.log statements.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Lines contain only console.log with template literals for user-friendly output. No shell or Ruby backtick execution present.

dangerous_patterns.title: Empty String Field Misidentified as Weak Crypto
dangerous_patterns.description: Static scanner flagged empty package.json description field and YAML front matter as weak cryptographic algorithms.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: These lines contain empty strings, field names, and YAML front matter values - not cryptographic algorithms. No encryption code present.

content.user_title: Capture screenshots and extract web content
content.value_statement: Browser automation is essential for testing, data extraction, and visual verification. This skill provides a reliable way to capture screenshots and extract text or HTML content from any web page using Playwright.
actual_capabilities: Navigate to any URL and wait for page load
Capture full-page screenshots in base64 format
Extract text content from page or specific elements
Extract HTML markup from specific DOM elements
limitations: Cannot interact with pages (no clicks, typing, or form submission)
Cannot execute JavaScript on target pages
Cannot handle authentication or login flows

use_cases.title: Visual regression testing
use_cases.description: Take screenshots of web pages to compare against baseline images for visual regression testing.

use_cases.title: Content extraction for analysis
use_cases.description: Extract text or HTML content from web pages for downstream processing or analysis.

use_cases.title: Documentation and reporting
use_cases.description: Capture screenshots of web pages for documentation, reports, or presentations.

prompt_templates.title: Extract text from element
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the text content from the main heading on https://example.com using the selector 'h1'

prompt_templates.title: Extract HTML content
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract the HTML content of the article section from https://example.com/blog/article

prompt_templates.title: Full page screenshot with selector
prompt_templates.prompt: Take a screenshot of the product gallery on https://example.com/shop/product using selector '.product-gallery'

output_examples.input: Get the text from the heading on https://example.com
Extract the HTML from the main content on https://example.com
output: This domain is for use in illustrative examples...

best_practices: Use specific CSS selectors to target exact elements for extraction
Handle screenshots as base64-encoded strings for easy transmission
Set appropriate timeout values for slow-loading pages
Close browsers properly with try-finally blocks to prevent resource leaks
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill to scrape websites that prohibit automated access
Avoid capturing screenshots of pages with sensitive or personal information
Do not rely on this for interactive web testing that requires user simulation
Avoid extracting content from pages behind authentication without proper credentials

faq.question: What browsers are supported?
faq.answer: This skill uses Chromium via Playwright. Firefox and WebKit are not currently supported.

faq.question: Can I interact with pages (click, type)?
faq.answer: No, this skill only supports navigation, screenshot capture, and content extraction. Use a different tool for interactive browser automation.

faq.question: How are screenshots delivered?
faq.answer: Screenshots are output as base64-encoded strings wrapped between SCREENSHOT_START and SCREENSHOT_END markers.

faq.question: What is the default selector?
faq.answer: The default CSS selector is 'body', which captures the entire page content.

faq.question: Can I extract content from dynamic pages?
faq.answer: This skill waits for DOM content to load but does not wait for JavaScript execution or network idle. Use the text action for static content extraction.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill runs in headless mode with no user interaction. It only navigates to URLs you specify and extracts content locally.
